body_html:
I moved to nightly build on docker. I tried to set state = cell_state as well, but no difference. If I write instead of
prev_state_y = tf.slice(prev_state_y, [0, output_size*4], [-1, output_size*2])
this
prev_state_y = tf.slice(state, [0, output_size*4], [-1, output_size*2])
Then it works like a usual RNN without giving any error on reading or writing the loop_state TensorArray

this

body:
I moved to nightly build on docker. I tried to set state = cell_state as well, but no difference. If I write instead of 
`prev_state_y = tf.slice(prev_state_y, [0, output_size*4], [-1, output_size*2])` 
this 
`prev_state_y = tf.slice(state, [0, output_size*4], [-1, output_size*2])`
Then it works like a usual RNN without giving any error on reading or writing the loop_state TensorArray
